intro: Calycoseris wrightii var. californica, commonly known as the California calycoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
